title: Exhaust Header Pipes - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Always note the position and orientation of exhaust clamps prior to releasing them, and return them to the noted position and orientation on assembly.

body.body: Exhaust Header Pipe Removal DV; DVB; DX4
Note the routing of the oxygen sensor harness for installation.
The oxygen sensor electrical connections must not be swapped between cylinders. If the connections are swapped over, engine malfunctions will occur.
The right hand (Cylinder 2) oxygen sensor harness has a small section of red tape for identification.
The oxygen sensors are NOT marked. Always ensure the right hand oxygen sensor harness is connected to the correct main harness connector, identified by the red tape.
The brake line bracket scrivet may need to be released to allow access to the electrical connections.
Disconnect the oxygen sensors from the main harness.
Remove the fixings and the finned clamps securing the exhaust header pipes to the cylinder head.

body.name: Header pipe to cylinder head cjcq

body.body: Release the clamp fixing and remove the cover from the left hand side exhaust.
Release the clamp fixing securing the right hand silencer to the header pipe.

body.name: RH Exhaust Silencer Clamp Bolt DV (L0146)

body.body: Loosen the clamps securing the exhaust header pipes to the catalytic converter.
Detach the exhaust header pipes from the catalytic converter and remove the exhaust header pipes. Remove and discard the gaskets from the cylinder head ports.
Remove and discard the exhaust header pipe gaskets from the catalytic converter.
If necessary, remove the oxygen sensors.
